default_library::tip_collection::tips[21: Keep recording for at least 15 seconds, if the clip is too long, trim it.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[84: A good series should be made up of five strong images. If you have more good shots, add them in though.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[67: A climax is the answer on the question that keeps your listener listening. Don't give it away too early.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[11: Your story will be more interesting if you interview characters with opposing viewpoints.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think should be done about the issue?
default_library::quiz_card_cliptype::que: What would you like to focus on?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[26: Hit record before you ask a question to record a few seconds of silence before speaking.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[54: If your questions do not provide a satisfactory answer, change your approach.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[9]: Get to the most important question quickly in the interview.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think should be done about the issue?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[23: To shoot a sequence you need to break down the elements of your story into individual shots.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[14: "The size of an object in the frame should equal it's importance at that moment." -Alfred Hitchcock
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think the character should do next?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[75: Pay attention to the edges of your frame not just the middle.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[85: Tell us some interesting facts about the history of the issue or why it started.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[15: Ensure the most important part of your shot fills at least 50% of the frame.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[62: If you can feel the light source on the back of your neck on a sunny day, you will have the best lighting in that situation.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[81: Good photographs are about peak action and drama. Choose your moments with that in mind.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[28: Use multiple sources of audio to tell your story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[35: Focus on a single primary topic to tell a concise and clear story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[42: Courtesy can help establish trust and improve your interviews.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[31: Think about the audience you want to reach when considering what Topic and Format to use.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[30: Use your own voice as little as possible, tell the story through the voices of others.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[61: If the light source is directly behind your subject, the subject will be dark and difficult to see.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[53: Keep the conversation moving. Ask: Why? What happened next? What do you mean?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[52: Don't ask 'closed' questions that can be answered in one word such as 'yes' or 'no'.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think the character should do next?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[25: Clear and interesting sound can paint a good picture in the mind of anyone who listens.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[71: Get as close to your subject as possible.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[83: Taking your picture from an interesting angle of view can make a much better portrait.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[20: "If your picture's not good enough, you're not close enough." -Robert Capa
default_library::tip_collection::tips[6]: Have a one-sentence explanation of your story for your characters.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[50: In a crowd, shoot away from the crowd for better audio, ask your subject to face you.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[55: Use follow-up questions if you need more information.
default_library::quiz_card_format::choic: Collect a set of pictures of people.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What is your opinion of the character?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[13: Well composed shots have space in the direction the subject is facing, or moving.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[65: Sound is half of the information in a video, consider it for every shot.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[46: Make sure your subject is in focus and not distorted by something in the frame.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[0]: Aim for 8 to 20 images in your final edit. Shoot more pictures than you plan to use.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[1]: Every new image should contain new information that advances your story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[89: Tell us how the event changes as it progresses.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[12: End the interview by asking, "Is there anything else you would like to add?"
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think is the most exciting part of the event?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[34: When recording an interview, prepare at least 15 questions.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[43: Listen for background noise that may harm the quality of your story before you click record.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[79: Don't forget to get signature shots when possible.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[78: Don't take just one photograph. Take lots. Experiment.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What is your opinion of the event?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[24: Shoot different size shots to create an effective sequence.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[76: Good photography is all about light. Are you using available light as best you can?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[40: Ask only one question at a time.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[41: Ask hard questions, but remember to be polite. A polite request will go a long way.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[8]: Prioritize your questions and identify the single, most essential bit of information you need.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[51: If it is windy, point your camera away from the wind, or block if with your body or a wall.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[17: Do not stop recording until the action in your shot is complete.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What is your opinion of the event?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[82: For a series your images should be composed as identically as possible.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[18: Start the camera rolling before the action begins and don't stop recording until after it ends.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[7]: Save sensitive questions for the end.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[63: Low light can produce poor shots. Shooting outside or in a sunny room can give you great light.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: Which question would you like to use?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[22: Always update your White Balance setting when you move to a different lighting situation.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[58: Crowds and busy streets make a lot of noise. Do not shoot interviews in front of crowds or busy streets.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[44: When preparing to record, hold your device in a way that is comfortable and natural.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[45: Hold your device close to the subject, and just below their mouth.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[3]: Know yourself, be aware of your biases don't let them influence how you portray your story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[37: Be clear about your topic or goal when requesting an interview.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[57: If it is windy, point your camera away from the wind, or protect your mic.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[56: Remember, without good sound your images only tell half the story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[59: Machines make a lot of noise, turn them off if possible, or change your location if you can.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What is your opinion of the issue?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[38: Be calm. Relaxing will help your interview subject relax too.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[68: A climax is the answer on the question that holds the attention of the viewer. Don't give it away too early.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[32: Even if time is limited, make a plan, do not record everything you hear.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[47: Decide the best place to record from and hold your frame in place until complete.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[64: Lights approximately 3 feet away from your character are the most flattering.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[87: Tell us what is expected for the issue in the future.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[70: Ask yourself for every clip: does it tell me something new about my major question?
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What do you think is the most exciting part of the event?
What is your opinion of the character?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[48: Don't hold your breath, set your shot, and breathe. When your shot is steady, begin recording
default_library::quiz_card_format::choic: Ask the same question to many people.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[10: In your interview, remember to be tough but fair.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[60: Record your subject with the light source directly on the subject.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[49: Don't pan. If you want a new angle, stop recording. Change your frame, and record a new shot.
default_library::quiz_card_format::quest: How would you like to tell it?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[77: Simply changing the angle of view can make a much better photograph.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[27: Check your audio level using headphones before you start recording.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[19: Do not place your subject in the center of the frame, use the rule of thirds.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[39: Always know what you want from the interview.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[72: Remember: the viewer won't know anything about your story that you don’t show them in the photograph.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[2]: Even if you will only use one image in your story, shoot a variety of images to choose from.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[4]: When shooting in dangerous situations always have an exit strategy.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[5]: Do some research before the interview when possible. You will ask better, more relevant questions.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[90: Tell us what is expected for the event the next time it happens.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[36: Record first hand observations and interviews whenever possible.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[88: Tell us some interesting facts about the history of the event or why it happens.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[33: Even if time is limited, make a plan, do not shoot everything you see.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[69: Ask yourself for every clip: does it tell me something new?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[80: Get a variety of images -- close-ups, medium shots and wide shots.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[16: Combine clips of different sizes or types to create a complementary sequence.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[29: Find different sounds and quotes that help tell your story.
default_library::tip_collection::tips[66: Every story has a major question. What's the question you've answered at the end of your item?
default_library::tip_collection::tips[86: Tell us how the issue is changing in response to the actions of characters in the story.
default_library::quiz_card_clipquestion:: What is your opinion of the issue?
